Only ancient Sumer offers a challenge to this claim. Whether beer was first brewed in Sumer or Egypt is still argued—the timing was close, whichever country won the race. One difference in beers of these two ancient countries is that Egyptians strained theirs as we do before drinking, Sumerians instead sipped theirs through a straw

Egyptian Art in the Days of the Pharaohs 3100–320 b.c
A broad, accurate and intelligent survey of all forms of Egyptian art
Jewels of the Pharaohs
The standard work on royal jewelry, including Tutankhamen’s
Everyday Life in Ancient Egypt
A quirky book that nevertheless contains specific information on marriage contracts
33rd St., Long Island City, NY 11106). This magazine covers the whole ancient world but almost every issue includes at least one article on ancient Egypt
Building in Egypt: Pharaonic Stone Masonry
The definitive book on how Egyptians quarried and worked with stone
A History of Egyptian Architecture
The most detailed account of Egyptian architecture with many examples

collection-title: Explains the technical aspects of ownership in ancient Egypt
container-title: Journal of the American Research Center in Egypt
title: The Low Price of Land in Ancient Egypt
Ancient Egypt’s Warfare
Contains accounts of major Egyptian battles along with descriptions from the Egyptian records
Hieroglyphics: The Writings of Ancient Egypt
Descriptions of all the hieroglyphs with good illustrations
Following Thutmose I on his Campaign to Kush
A detailed presentation of one ancient military campaign
The Edwin Smith Surgical Papyrus
Provides good information about clinical medicine
Ancient Egyptian Magic
How the Egyptians practiced magic, including many spells
Egyptian Mummies
The details of Egyptian mummification
The Murder of Tutankhamen
Presents the life and possibly violent death of the famous young king
The Egyptian Book of the Dead
A translation of a complete Book of the Dead along with the actual hieroglyphs
Egyptian Magic
An older book containing examples of magic spells seldom presented elsewhere
The Gods of the Egyptians
This reprint of an old book is dated but encyclopedic
The Mummy
A reprint of an old book that remains useful for its details of the funerary customs of ancient Egypt
Consanguineous Marriages in Pharaonic Egypt
Discusses all known cases of nonroyal brother-sister marriages

note: Reprint of Oxford University Press, 1930). Some good information about building in Egypt, though superseded in some cases by more recent books.
title: Ancient Egyptian Construction and Architecture
Chronicle of the Pharaohs: The Reign-by-Reign Record of the Rulers and Dynasties of Ancient Egypt
A superior reference for all the kings and queens and their dates
Food: The Gift of Osiris
Encyclopedic treatment of food in ancient Egypt
The Theban Tomb Series
Abundant pictures of tomb scenes
Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum: VII Tools and Weapons
Presents clear examples of ancient Egyptian weapons
Living Architecture: Egyptian
A general discussion of Egyptian temples and houses. Desroches-Noblecourt, Christiane. Tutankhamen: Life and Death of a Pharaoh
Fine pictures of the life and times of Tutankhamen
Life in Ancient Egypt
This reprint of a century-old book still provides useful information and contains abundant illustrations
The Medical Skills of Ancient Egypt
A solid survey of Egyptian medical skills
The Egyptian Book of the Dead
An excellent recent translation of The Book of the Dead, with lovely color illustrations
Chronicle of a Pharaoh: The Intimate Life of Amenhotep III
A well illustrated, readable biography
Love Songs of the New Kingdom
Beautiful translations of love poems including the hieroglyphs in some cases
Egypt of the Pharaohs
Provides much material about the history of ancient Egypt, with some idiosyncratic comments
Hieratic Papyri in the British Museum
Presents the actual words of ancient Egyptians
The Kadesh Inscriptions of Ramses II
A complete presentation of how Rameses wished the public to view his largest military campaign
Magic and Medical Science in Ancient Egypt
A solid book on the connections between magic and medicine in Egypt
On an Ancient Egyptian Method of Diagnosing Pregnancy and Detecting Foetal Sex
A modern experiment to assess the reliability of an ancient Egyptian pregnancy test
Mathematics in the Time of the Pharaohs
The best survey of mathematics in ancient Egypt

note: Presents the view that Egyptians studied animals to learn about human anatomy.
title: Origins of Ancient Egyptian Medicine
The Oxyrhynchus Papyri Part XI
Presents a variety of magical spells
Warfare in the Ancient World
Stirring accounts of ancient battles and the techniques used by both sides
The Scepter of Egypt
Covers the extensive Egyptian collection of New York’s Metropolitan Museum with abundant details of objects of daily life
Still interesting for tidbits and an ancient Greek view of the ancient Egyptians
Ancient Egyptian, Assyrian and Persian Costumes
Although dated, this work shows how clothing was made and worn in ancient Egypt
Death and Burial in Ancient Egypt
An excellent survey of the ancient Egyptian view of resurrection and mummification
Food for Eternity: What the Ancient Egyptians Ate and Drank
A good summary of the Egyptian diet
The Boat Beneath the Pyramid
A readable account of the only complete pharonic boat ever found
A Survey of the Ancient City of El-Amarna
The detailed and up-to-date presentation of what Akhenaten’s city must have looked like
Ancient Egyptian Furniture
Boxes, Chests and Footstools
A scholarly study on furniture with clear drawings that show the construction
Pharaoh Triumphant: The Life and Times of Rameses II
An authoritative account of the life of Rameses the Great
KMT: A Modern Journal of Ancient Egypt. P.O. box 1475, Sevastapol, CA 95473. Devoted entirely to ancient Egypt with readable articles in every issue
Ships of the Pharaohs: 4000 years of Egyptian Shipbuilding
Through exceptional illustrations and drawings, ancient Egyptian ships are analysed and explained
The Complete Pyramids
A comprehensive survey of all the pyramids with fine photographs and computer-generated diagrams
King Tut’s Wine Cellar
A comprehensive discussion of the largest ancient wine cellar ever found
Ancient Egyptian Literature
The best collection of ancient Egyptian stories, prayers and records
Chariots and Related Equipment from the Tomb of Tutankhamen
A thorough description of the most complete chariot ever found
Ancient Egyptian Materials and Industries
Detailed and technical discussions of how Egyptians made things
Self Bows and Other Archery Tackle from the Tomb of Tutankhamen
Descriptions of Tutankhamen’s bows and arrows
Art of Ancient Egypt
A survey of the best in Egyptian art with glorious photographs

note: Lends an insight into ancient “miracle” cures.
title: The Sanatorium of Dier-el-Bahri
Everyday Life in Egypt During the Days of Ramesses the Great
A survey of everyday life during one of the great periods of ancient Egypt
Studies in the Paleopathology of Egypt
A technical discussion of disease in ancient Egypt, based on autopsies of mummies
Ancient Egyptian Medicine
The latest and best book on medical practice in ancient Egypt
Palaeoepidemiology of Schistosoma Infection in Mummies

note: How the Egyptians moved objects, on both land and water.
title: Transport in Ancient Egypt
Arts and Crafts of Ancient Egypt
A legendary early Egyptologist describes finds that relate to Egyptian crafts
The Pyramid of Unis
A thorough discussion of the oldest Egyptian religious writing
The British Museum Book of Ancient Egypt
A solid, quick reference book
Egyptian Mythology A to Z
Written for young adults, this book lists all the gods of Egypt and describes them in detail. Good illustrations
The Rhind Mathematical Papyrus
A detailed discussion of the most important Egyptian mathematical work ever found
The Great Pyramid
The most detailed discussion of this building, including some new theories

note: Shows that one medical problem was more common in ancient times than it is today.
title: Note on the Presence of ‘Bilharzia haemotobia’ in Egyptian Mummies of the XXth Dynasty
Daily Life in Ancient Egypt
Some informative illustrations
The Sea Peoples: Warriors of the Ancient Mediterranean
A discussion of these enigmatic people with an attempt to discover who they were
Un Traité Égyptien d’Ophiologie
Translation of the Egyptian treatment of snake bites
Egyptian Metalworking and Tools
A concise, illustrated discussion of metallurgy in ancient Egypt
The Literature of Ancient Egypt
A fine collection of short stories, myths and religious texts of ancient Egypt
Art and Architecture of Ancient Egypt
A basic but extensive survey of all Egyptian arts
Ancient Egyptian & Cnidian Medicine
A technical work on the Egyptian theory of disease
Experiments in Egyptian Archaeology: Stoneworking technology in Ancient Egypt
Discovers how ancient Egyptians worked stone through actual experiments
Ancient Egypt: A Social History
Technical essays by authorities on various aspects of Egyptian society
Daughters of Isis: Women of Ancient Egypt
An excellent account of the situation of women in ancient Egypt
Hatchepsut: The Female Pharaoh
A good, scholarly biography of the queen who became pharaoh
Nefertiti: Egypt’s Sun Queen
Written by an Egyptologist, this is a scholarly but readable biography of a famous queen
Studies in Ancient Egyptian Anatomical Terminology
The hieroglyphs used by ancient Egyptians for various parts of the human body
Costume of Ancient Egypt
Some good illustrations of clothing
The Anatomical Knowledge of the Ancient Egyptians and the Representation of the Human Figure in Egyptian Art
A very technical discussion of the understanding of anatomy in ancient Egypt as shown by the words and drawings of the Egyptians themselves
Sculpture and Architecture of Ancient Egypt
A chronological survey of Egyptian art with fine pictures of the masterpieces
The Ancient Egyptians, Their Life and Customs
This reprint of the first book on the everyday life of ancient Egyptians still contains the most extensive illustrations from tomb paintings
Readings in Egyptian Art
A clear introduction to hieroglyphs and how they were used in Egyptian art
Models of Daily Life in Ancient Egypt: From the Tomb of Meket-Re at Thebes
Clear pictures of ancient models that show what the real things must have been like
The Art of Egypt
A basic illustrated history of Egyptian art
The Art of Warfare in Biblical Lands
Abundant pictures and descriptions of wars in the ancient world, involving both Egypt and other countries
